intro: Zephyranthes andicola, commonly known as the Andean rain lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in response to rainfall. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that help it survive dry periods. Zephyranthes andicola is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
